Dear Kathleen SUZANNE Sperling:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 09/13/2024 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12509 Independent living record
• (3) The case record must contain all the
following information and documentation, which
must be recorded within 30 calendar days after
placement in independent living and updated at
least once every 90 calendar days:
• (n) Change of placement documentation
as required by R 400.12405.
One of the three independent living youth records reviewed indicated the youth
had a change in placement that was not documented timely as required. In this
example the youth left their approved independent living placement without
notifying the agency. The agency was able to identify the youth's current
placement on 6/27/2024, but did not document/identify the current/new placement
as required until 7/30/2024. This documentation should have been completed by
7/11/2024.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Explanation was provided to the agency that future DCWL audits would not
include policy and contract issues.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a CAP for the interim evaluation completed 11/30/2023. Areas
identified in noncompliance were Rule 327(6)(c), and Rule 327(7). The CAP was
approved 2/20/2024 by DCWL. Neither of these areas were identified in
noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. It included the agency's
review of the action steps included in the corrective action plan. The agency is
currently maintaining compliance with the corrective action plan.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: Pool required a self-latching gate mechanism.
Resolution #1: A self-latching mechanism was provided and installed. Agency
provided photo confirmation/documentation.
CAP was approved by DCWL 6/5/2024.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
